title: Emotions Linger After Forgotten Events In Alzheimer's Patients
teaser: A new study suggests that people with Alzheimer's can hold on to happy or sad feelings, even if they forget what triggered them. NPR's Ari Shapiro speaks with the study's author, Edmarie Guzman-Velez.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
